Jim Phinney was elected President of the Student Council last

Veverka New
IFB Leader

'Stormers To Offer
Three-Act-Comedy
In'Boy Meets Girl'

Wednesday, gathering 184 votes
out of the 581 ballots cast.
Edward Habermann ran second
with 142 votes, followed by Warren Grupe with 122 votes and
Joseph Gluhman with 96 votes.
The

65%

turnout

of

eligible

voters was a drop from last year's
record 74%.
Phinney is a veteran of the
Korean

War.

He is Dormitory

Social Chairman and Vice-president of the Booster Club. During
his first year here he received the
ODK award for the outstanding
freshma n.
JIM PHINNEY

Yale Beaten
By Jays, 12-5
Attackman Bob Taylor's four
goals and Goalie Lou Ruland's 17
saves paced the Hopkins lacrosse
team to a 12-5 win over Yale,
Wednesday. The victory gave the
Jays a season slate of 2-1-1.

Phinney issued the following
statement: "I wish at this time
to thank all students who sup- ported my candidacy for office.
I will make every attempt to represent the Student Body in a manner befitting the office of President of the Student Council. I
offer congratulations to all men
elected to office. I know you will
do your jobs well. I urge all students to support these officers during the coming year; for, they can
accomplish nothing without your
wholehearted support."
Of the 895 eligible voters, 182
juniors, 191 sophomores, and 203
freshmen voted. Seventy-two per
cent of the junior class, 62% of
the sophomore class, and 68% of
the freshman class voted.
Alan Birtch, retiring Student'
Council - President, congratulated
the candidates for 'one of the
liveliest campaigns, and yet most
orderly of recent years."

"'Night People' has many assets. Johnson's script is slashingly
written and his action is paced
like a rapier duel. Gregory Peck
does one of his dominant, towering 'Command Decision' jobs as a
lieutenant colonel of counter-intelligence. The ending alone is
disappointing; the story paints
itself into a corner from which
there is no escape except the kind
of deceit which ought to be the
exclusive property of the villains.
Except for this, 'Night People' has
the mysterious air and staccato.
performance of a good spy
thriller ...

Experienced Cast
Peter Fischer, Joe Winters, and
Paul Asselin have had previous
experience with the Barnstormers
and the Playshop. Tom Ross and
John Basinski are newcomers to
the Hopkins stage. Pieri Fernandez has appeared on radio, television, and the professional stage.
She has directed and written
plays, some of Which have been
produced in her native Puerto
Rico. Pieri has also given dramatic interpretations of poetry in
cities along the Atlantic seaboard,
In Puerto Rico, Spain, Italy, and
Photo by Glen K. Parker
South America. In the near fuTOM ROSS, PIER! FERNANDEZ and JOHN BASINSKI rehearse
ture she will give such readings at for the Barnstormer production of "Boy Meets (AO," to be presented
Goucher College, Enoch Pratt Li:April 30 and May 1.
brary, and Georgetown University.
Satire On Movies
This fast-moving comedy is actually a satire on the motion picture induslry. To quote director
Jim Byrd, "This play starts off
with a bang and never lets down."
Prestdent Charlie Cook and Veep
Joe Donahue of the Barnstormers
are handling the publicity and
other business transactions. Harry
Mottek is in charge of the lighting.

You can easily tell the difference between engines when you drive—
and the difference is all in Chevrolet's favor! That's because
Chevrolet's great engines deliver full horsepower where it counts—
on the road. What Chevrolet promises, Chevrolet delivers!

There's new power, new performance and new economy in both
1954 Chevrolet engines—the "Blue-Flame 125" in Powerglide
models and the "Blue-Flame 115" in gearshift models. And they
bring you the highest compression ratio of any leading low-priced
car. That's why they can deliver a big gain in power, acceleration
and all-around performance, along with important gasoline savings!

H.C.Byrd To Speak

Improvement Made
Wendell Smith, Chairman of
the committee, reported that the
Student Council felt improvement
has been made although "it is of
an intangible nature." "At any
rate," Smith continued, "the Plant
Manager's Office is now aware of
all the problems."
"Dorm students seem satisfied
now and there seems to be less
discontent at Levering," Smith
added.
Smith called the Council into
executive session at their meeting
last Tuesday to discuss the results of his committee's work
throughout the year.

Homewood, Baltimore, April 23, 1954

NEWS-LETTER

"Lots Of Depth"
Coach Pope asserts, "The team
has lots of depth. Although we
may lose a first or second round
match, we'll win enough of the
other matches to gain the victory."
Besides the six singles matches,
there will be three doubles matches
Tuesday. According to Pope, Switky and Creamer are the first doubles team; Butler and Barfield, the
second; and Anderson and Pedorella, the third.

ing Hall on Thursday, May 6, at
4 p.m.
He will be presented by the Hopkins Political Association, which
is trying to bring all gubernatorial
candidates to the campus.

Jay Thinclads To Compete
For Relay Crown In Philly
Hopkins' Mile Relay team this
afternoon toes the mark in the
Mason-Dixon Mile Relay Championship, held in conjunction with
the Penn Relays at Franklin
Field, Philadelphia.
The Hopkins coartet of Al Heck,
Tom Stone, Don Manger, and
Clark Thompson, with Jack Sutherland as alternate, will be among
the more than 3,000 participants
in the country's largest track meet.
Baltimore Relays
The whole team will be participating tomorrow in the • annual
Baltimore Relays at Clifton Park.

In addition, the Hopkins freshalas
team will run in these relays.

Wednesday, gathering 184 votes
out of the 581 ballots cast.
Edward Habermann ran second
with 142 votes, followed by Warren Grupe with 122 votes and
Joseph Gluhman with 96 votes.
The

65%

turnout

of

eligible

voters was a drop from last year's
record 74%.
Phinney is a veteran of the
Korean

War.

He is Dormitory

Social Chairman and Vice-president of the Booster Club. During
his first year here he received the
ODK award for the outstanding
freshma n.
JIM PHINNEY

Yale Beaten
By Jays, 12-5
Attackman Bob Taylor's four
goals and Goalie Lou Ruland's 17
saves paced the Hopkins lacrosse
team to a 12-5 win over Yale,
Wednesday. The victory gave the
Jays a season slate of 2-1-1.

Phinney issued the following
statement: "I wish at this time
to thank all students who sup- ported my candidacy for office.
I will make every attempt to represent the Student Body in a manner befitting the office of President of the Student Council. I
offer congratulations to all men
elected to office. I know you will
do your jobs well. I urge all students to support these officers during the coming year; for, they can
accomplish nothing without your
wholehearted support."
Of the 895 eligible voters, 182
juniors, 191 sophomores, and 203
freshmen voted. Seventy-two per
cent of the junior class, 62% of
the sophomore class, and 68% of
the freshman class voted.
Alan Birtch, retiring Student'
Council - President, congratulated
the candidates for 'one of the
liveliest campaigns, and yet most
orderly of recent years."

"'Night People' has many assets. Johnson's script is slashingly
written and his action is paced
like a rapier duel. Gregory Peck
does one of his dominant, towering 'Command Decision' jobs as a
lieutenant colonel of counter-intelligence. The ending alone is
disappointing; the story paints
itself into a corner from which
there is no escape except the kind
of deceit which ought to be the
exclusive property of the villains.
Except for this, 'Night People' has
the mysterious air and staccato.
performance of a good spy
thriller ...

Experienced Cast
Peter Fischer, Joe Winters, and
Paul Asselin have had previous
experience with the Barnstormers
and the Playshop. Tom Ross and
John Basinski are newcomers to
the Hopkins stage. Pieri Fernandez has appeared on radio, television, and the professional stage.
She has directed and written
plays, some of Which have been
produced in her native Puerto
Rico. Pieri has also given dramatic interpretations of poetry in
cities along the Atlantic seaboard,
In Puerto Rico, Spain, Italy, and
Photo by Glen K. Parker
South America. In the near fuTOM ROSS, PIER! FERNANDEZ and JOHN BASINSKI rehearse
ture she will give such readings at for the Barnstormer production of "Boy Meets (AO," to be presented
Goucher College, Enoch Pratt Li:April 30 and May 1.
brary, and Georgetown University.
Satire On Movies
This fast-moving comedy is actually a satire on the motion picture induslry. To quote director
Jim Byrd, "This play starts off
with a bang and never lets down."
Prestdent Charlie Cook and Veep
Joe Donahue of the Barnstormers

Food

H.C.Byrd To Speak

Improvement Made
Wendell Smith, Chairman of
the committee, reported that the
Student Council felt improvement
has been made although "it is of
an intangible nature." "At any
rate," Smith continued, "the Plant
Manager's Office is now aware of
all the problems."
"Dorm students seem satisfied
now and there seems to be less
discontent at Levering," Smith
added.
Smith called the Council into
executive session at their meeting
last Tuesday to discuss the results of his committee's work
throughout the year.

Homewood, Baltimore, April 23, 1954

NEWS-LETTER

"Lots Of Depth"
Coach Pope asserts, "The team
has lots of depth. Although we
may lose a first or second round
match, we'll win enough of the
other matches to gain the victory."
Besides the six singles matches,
there will be three doubles matches
Tuesday. According to Pope, Switky and Creamer are the first doubles team; Butler and Barfield, the
second; and Anderson and Pedorella, the third.

He will be presented by the Hopkins Political Association, which
is trying to bring all gubernatorial
candidates to the campus.

Jay Thinclads To Compete
For Relay Crown In Philly
Hopkins' Mile Relay team this
afternoon toes the mark in the
Mason-Dixon Mile Relay Championship, held in conjunction with
the Penn Relays at Franklin
Field, Philadelphia.
The Hopkins coartet of Al Heck,
Tom Stone, Don Manger, and
Clark Thompson, with Jack Sutherland as alternate, will be among
the more than 3,000 participants
in the country's largest track meet.
Baltimore Relays
The whole team will be participating tomorrow in the • annual
Baltimore Relays at Clifton Park.

team will run in these relays.
